solution_line_template: Removing the time of the train ride from the journey shows that his trip to get on the train took him {total_trip_hours} hours – {train_ride_hours} hours = <<{total_trip_hours}-{train_ride_hours}={time_before_train_hours}>>{time_before_train_hours} hours.

Converting this time into minutes shows that getting to the train took {time_before_train_hours} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{time_before_train_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={time_before_train_minutes}>>{time_before_train_minutes} minutes.

Waiting for the train to arrive took twice as long as his walk, so {walk_time_minutes} minutes * {twice_multiplier} = <<{walk_time_minutes}*{twice_multiplier}={wait_time_minutes}>>{wait_time_minutes} minutes.

This means that his bus ride must have taken {time_before_train_minutes} minutes – {wait_time_minutes} minutes - {walk_time_minutes} minutes = <<{time_before_train_minutes}-{wait_time_minutes}-{walk_time_minutes}={bus_ride_minutes}>>{bus_ride_minutes} minutes.
